data.title: X (Twitter) Statistics – Users, Usage & Revenue [2024]
data.meta_description: Explore X Twitter statistics, insights, and usage that are shaping this social media platform owned by Elon Musk.
data.text:
X is just a new name for Twitter. But in reality, it’s the same platform, where you share short thoughts, called tweets.

Read on and discover the latest user statistics, average time spent on the platform, and X’s revenue.

Twitter to X

Twitter started in 2006 and quickly became a favorite place for people to share short messages, called ‘tweets’.

Users immediately started to love it for quick updates, following famous folks, and talking about trendy stuff online.

Twitter had 330 million users

There were approximately 500 million tweets sent every day

The average Twitter user spent around 3.39 minutes per session on the platform

80% of Twitter’s users access the platform via mobile devices

The peak user activity time on Twitter is between 12 pm and 3 pm

85% of small and medium businesses leverage Twitter for marketing

But now, there’s something new – X Corp.

So, what do you think – can we still tweet like before, even though it’s called X now?

Let’s dig in.

What Is X Corp

X-Corporation (X-Corp) is a brand-new tech company set up by Elon Musk in July 2023.

It’s part of X Holdings Corp., also owned by Musk.

X Corp Company Overview

Year founded: 9 March 2023

Headquarters: San Francisco, California, United States

Owner: Elon Musk

Industry: Social media

Musk sees X-Corp as more than just social media – he wants it to be an “everything app”.

So, besides tweeting and socializing, you’ll have loads of different services all in one place.

Now, let us ask you:

Loading ...

A Closer Look Into X Corp’s Vision

As we said before, X Corp is taking things to another level.

(It will be much more than just tweeting).

You will be able to talk to friends, live stream, pay for stuff, get a ride or even order food.

Kinda feels like China’s WeChat, doesn’t it?

From dating and shopping to streaming shows, food delivery, or banking, X Corp aims to be your go-to for everything.

Embracing Change: Twitter’s Evolution into X

Indeed, the winds of change are already blowing!

The iconic Twitter bird is gone, replaced by a stylish ‘X’ logo.

The classic http://twitter.com domain?

It now redirects you directly to http://x.com.

Now, you can write much longer posts – up to 4,000 characters, instead of the old 280.

Will Twitter users who are now X users embrace this change?

Let’s explore.

What Does This Mean For Current Twitter Users

For sure, the shift from Twitter to X raises some applicable questions for ‘old’ Twitter users.

About 48% of Twitter users indicated that they use the platform to read news.

A similar number relied on Twitter for fun, relaxation, and entertainment.

Now, here’s a question…

Will people start using X for more than just news and entertainment?

Could X’s additional solutions outshine its original, news-centric appeal?

Source: Twitter

The Impact Of X Corp On Twitter’s User Statistics

Before X Corp came along, Twitter had around 200 million users every month all over the world.

Most Twitter users were from the United States, Japan, Brazil, and the United Kingdom, and more and more people were starting to use it in India.

But when X Corp showed up, things really took off.

In just the first 12 hours, the number of users shot up to 400 million.

That’s double the number of users in half a day!

Clearly, X Corp is onto something big. 😉

Source: Statista

User Demographics

As X Corp rolls out more features and services, the types of people using the platform are likely to change and diversify.

Twitter Users By Gender

These were Twitter users sorted by gender:

Twitter had a diverse user base with a gender distribution of 63% male and 27% female, and its highest user activity time was between 12 pm and 3 pm.

By comparison, Instagram has 51.68 % male users and 48.2 % female users.

Meanwhile, Snapchat is used by 51% of females and 48.2% of males.

Source: Statista

Twitter Users By Age

Twitter has maintained a unique platform that attracts certain age groups.

59.2% of Twitter users are between the ages of 25 and 49, called Adult Twitter Users.

Number Of Twitter Users by Country

Which countries have the most Twitter users in 2023?

The United States leads the world in number of Twitter users, boasting a user base of 64.9 million.

North America is the region with the highest number of Twitter users among all regions.

Source: Statista

Most Popular Emojis

Users on social media often express themselves using emojis.

“Face with Tears of Joy” emoji has taken the top spot as the favored emoji among Twitter users in 2023.

Here are the other most popular emojis that people frequently use on Twitter.

😂 – Face with Tears of Joy

😭 – Loudly Crying Face

✨ – Sparkles

🤣 – Rolling on the Floor Laughing

🥺 – Pleading Face

❤️ – Red Heart

🙏 – Folded Hands

🥰 – Smiling Face with Hearts

😊 – Smiling Face with Smiling Eyes

It will be truly interesting to see if and how emoji usage evolves on X Corp.

Source: Emojipedia

Twitter Value

How much is Twitter worth?

When Twitter started in 2006, it was worth “only” 220,000 USD.

However, in just a few years, its value grew a lot, reaching 9.25 billion USD by 2011.

Twitter’s market cap was 41.09 billion USD in July 2023.

Source: Twitter

Twitter Annual Revenue

Is Twitter making money?

Well, not anymore.

However, most of Twitter’s revenue came from advertising and data licensing.

Twitter made revenue of over 4.4 billion USD by the end of 2022.

We show Twitter annual revenue from 2012 to 2022.

The future earnings of X Corp could see significant changes.

Source: Twitter

What’s Next For X Corp

The transformation of Twitter Inc into X Corp company marks a significant shift in the social media landscape.

Musk’s vision for X Corp as a “super app” could potentially change the way users interact with social media platforms.

As X Corp continues to develop, it will be interesting to monitor its growth and the impact of its expanded functionalities on user demographics and user engagement.
